de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.concepts

Interface Addable<NumberConcept extends Addable<? extends NumberConcept>>

  • Type Parameters:
    NumberConcept - A reference to the class or interface which the addition will result in.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    LabeledMatrix<LabelType>, Matrix, Ring<RingType>, Vector
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Interval, LabeledRegularMatrix, LabeledSymmetricMatrix, RegularMatrix, RegularVector, Scalar, SquareMatrix, SymmetricMatrix, Vector2D, Vector3D

    public interface Addable<NumberConcept extends Addable<? extends NumberConcept>>
    The "addition" operation can be any commutative and associative binary operation on a number concept.

    Addition is commutative, meaning that order does not matter, and it is associative, meaning that when one adds more than two numbers, the order in which addition is performed does not matter. Repeated addition of the "Additive One Element" is the same as counting; addition of a "Additive Zero Element" does not change a number.

    See Also:
    Wikipedia: Addition

      Adds all the given Objects (called summands) and returns a new Object (called sum).

    • Method Detail

      • sum

        static <NumberConcept extends Addable<NumberConcept>> NumberConcept sum(java.util.Collection<? extends NumberConcept> summands)
        Adds all the given Objects (called summands) and returns a new Object (called sum). No summand shall be changed.
        Type Parameters:
        NumberConcept - The concept.
        Parameters:
        summands - The summands.
        Returns:
        The sum of all Objects.

      • add

        NumberConcept add(NumberConcept summand)
        Adds the given Object (called summand) to this Object (also called summand) and returns a new Object (called sum). No summand shall be changed.
        Parameters:
        summand - Another object.
        Returns:
        The sum of this object and the given summand.
